sources.displayName: National Academy of Sciences on Atomic Fission
sources.citation: Report of National Academy of Sciences on Atomic Fission, February 6, 1989. https://nsarchive2.gwu.edu/nukevault/ebb525-The-Atomic-Bomb-and-the-End-of-World-War-II/documents/001a.pdf.
sources.annotation: This is a letter to President Jewett of the National Academy of Sciences addressing the meeting of Dr.Briggs' Uranium Committee discussing why the United States should begin to make advancements in nuclear research and development specifically on nuclear weapons.

sources.citation: “The Manhattan Project.” Atomic Heritage Foundation, May 12, 2017. https://www.atomicheritage.org/history/manhattan-project.
